post.title: Kate Bush – Aerial
post.content: Celebration of the sea, the sky, the banality and joy of life. Portraying the sublime beauty of the world as well as mundane objects, like a simple washing machine, in a poetic manner that strikes right trough the heart. The song of a blackbird occurs as the leitmotif of the album, smartly depicted as a waveform on the cover. Tons of emotions bursting out of Bush’s dramatic soprano in this 2005 record released after a twelve-year hiatus. An all time favorite that I keep coming back to.
